alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 3:39PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Hancock, southern Henry, west central Des Moines, eastern Van Buren, Lee, southeastern Jefferson, Clark and eastern Scotland Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 338 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lockridge to near Bentonsport/Vernon to near Colony. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Madison, Kahoka, Keosauqua, Warsaw, West Point, Donnellson, Wayland, Bonaparte, Salem, Stockport, Wyaconda, Hillsboro, Alexandria, Franklin, St. Paul, Luray, Granger, St. Francisville, New Boston, and Pilot Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
